description: Idea stage: Integrated environment for programming language design using large language models to verify and for assistance. The goal is to create a tool to lower the entry barrier and help language designers create better languages.
Idea stage: A high-level representation for WebAssembly.
A playful programming language. In very early development.
Browser-based and native (experimental) stock market data dashboard. The goal is to create a highly customizable and developer-like environment for financial professionals.

Domain-specific programming language for natural language arithmetic operations that is both simple and extensible. The parser is implemented as recursive-descent variant with precedence using stack structure instead of grammar rules.

Compiler that translates subset of Pascal into WebAssembly text format (built on top of MSc project). Lexer, recursive-descent parser (predictive), and code generator are hand-written for better error reporting.
